info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:31PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark County through 700 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lincoln, or 35 miles northeast of Drummond, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Lewis and Clark County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
